## Reflections on Writing Chapters 1 and 2

In this journal entry, reflect on your experience writing the first two chapters
of your junior seminar research report.

### Chapter 1: Introduction

#### Writing Process

- How did you approach writing the introduction?
- What was most challenging about articulating your research problem?
- How did you determine what background information to include?
- How did you identify and describe the key contributions of your project?

#### Content Reflections

- How well does your introduction motivate the research problem?
- Are the aims and objectives of your project clearly stated?
- Did you effectively highlight the ethical issues related to your work?
- What feedback have you received on your introduction?

### Chapter 2: Related Work

#### Literature Review Process

- How did you find relevant sources for your literature review?
- What criteria did you use to select which sources to include?
- How did you organize the related work into a coherent narrative?
- What strategies did you use to compare and contrast different approaches?

#### Content Reflections

- How well does your related work chapter situate your research?
- Did you identify gaps in existing work that your project addresses?
- How did you connect the related work to the ethical discussions in Chapter 1?
- What was the most interesting or surprising thing you learned from the literature?
- What feedback have you received on your related work chapter?

### Overall Reflections

- How do these two chapters work together to set up your research?
- What overall revisions do you plan to make based on feedback?
- What did you learn about academic writing through this process?
- How has writing these chapters deepened your understanding of your research?
